page.title: 05UPLAND SHEEP FARMING
page.content: This upland area,approximately three miles east north east of Macclesfield is comprised of enclosed rough grazing land and has been associated with sheep farming for at least three hundred years.The four farms situated in this area were all primarily concerned with sheep farming but only Horden Farm now continues this,the other farms having been purchased by local people for use as private dwellings. Horden Farm,comprising approximately three acres at present also produces a small range of pottery goods to be sold wholesale to shops,galleries and exibitions. The track running south from Horden Fm to the Setter Dog Public House was originally the Northwhich to Yorkshire salt trail used by the Romans but is now a public right of way.
